title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
overview: A novel about the serious issues of race, class, gender, and justice in the Deep South.

author: George Orwell
overview: A dystopian novel exploring themes of totalitarianism, surveillance, and individuality.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
overview: A romantic novel that also critiques the British landed gentry of the early 19th century.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
overview: A story about the Jazz Age, wealth, and the American dream in the 1920s.

title: Moby-Dick
author: Herman Melville
overview: A tale of obsession and revenge as Captain Ahab hunts the white whale, Moby Dick.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
overview: A story of a teenage boy, Holden Caulfield, struggling with finding his place in the adult world.

title: The Lord of the Rings
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
overview: An epic fantasy novel about the journey to destroy the One Ring.

title: Harry Potter and the Philosopher"s Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
overview: The first book in the Harry Potter series about a young wizard attending Hogwarts.

title: The Chronicles of Narnia
author: C.S. Lewis
overview: A fantasy series where children step into a magical world called Narnia.

title: Animal Farm
author: George Orwell
overview: A political allegory about farm animals overthrowing their human owner.

title: Jane Eyre
author: Charlotte Brontë
overview: The story of an orphaned girl who grows up to become a governess and falls in love with her employer.

title: Wuthering Heights
author: Emily Brontë
overview: A passionate tale of love, revenge, and obsession set on the Yorkshire moors.

title: Great Expectations
author: Charles Dickens
overview: A coming-of-age story about Pip, a young boy with big aspirations and a mysterious benefactor.

title: Les Misérables
author: Victor Hugo
overview: A tale of redemption and love during the French Revolution.

title: War and Peace
author: Leo Tolstoy
overview: A grand epic chronicling the lives of several aristocratic families during the Napoleonic wars.

title: Anna Karenina
author: Leo Tolstoy
overview: The tragic love story of Anna Karenina and her doomed affair with Count Vronsky.

title: Crime and Punishment
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
overview: A psychological thriller about a young man who commits a murder and struggles with his conscience.

title: The Brothers Karamazov
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
overview: A complex exploration of morality, free will, and the existence of God.

title: Madame Bovary
author: Gustave Flaubert
overview: A story of a woman’s unfulfilled dreams and romantic illusions, leading to her downfall.

title: The Odyssey
author: Homer
overview: An epic journey of the Greek hero Odysseus and his quest to return home from the Trojan War.

title: The Iliad
author: Homer
overview: The epic story of the Greek and Trojan warriors during the Trojan War.

title: A Tale of Two Cities
author: Charles Dickens
overview: A story set during the French Revolution, exploring themes of sacrifice and resurrection.

title: Frankenstein
author: Mary Shelley
overview: The classic tale of Dr. Frankenstein and the monster he creates.

title: Dracula
author: Bram Stoker
overview: A Gothic horror novel about Count Dracula’s attempt to move from Transylvania to England in order to spread the undead curse.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
overview: The precursor to The Lord of the Rings, following the adventures of Bilbo Baggins.

title: Don Quixote
author: Miguel de Cervantes
overview: The tale of an aging man who believes he is a knight, embarking on adventures with his faithful squire Sancho Panza.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
overview: A philosophical story about pursuing one’s personal legend and finding one’s destiny.

title: The Kite Runner
author: Khaled Hosseini
overview: A gripping story about friendship, betrayal, and redemption set against the backdrop of Afghanistan’s history.

title: Life of Pi
author: Yann Martel
overview: A story of survival and faith as Pi Patel survives a shipwreck in the Pacific Ocean with a Bengal tiger.

title: The Road
author: Cormac McCarthy
overview: A post-apocalyptic novel following a father and his son as they journey through a barren world.

title: Beloved
author: Toni Morrison
overview: A haunting novel about the horrors of slavery and a mother’s love.

title: The Color Purple
author: Alice Walker
overview: A story of an African-American woman’s struggles in the South during the early 20th century.

title: The Book Thief
author: Markus Zusak
overview: A young girl in Nazi Germany steals books and shares them with others while living through the horrors of World War II.

title: A Thousand Splendid Suns
author: Khaled Hosseini
overview: A story of two women in Afghanistan whose lives are bound together by love, war, and loss.

title: Memoirs of a Geisha
author: Arthur Golden
overview: The fictional account of a geisha’s life in Kyoto before and after World War II.

title: Slaughterhouse-Five
author: Kurt Vonnegut
overview: A science-fiction novel that blends the absurd with the tragic, following a soldier in World War II.

title: Fahrenheit 451
author: Ray Bradbury
overview: A dystopian novel set in a future where books are banned and burned.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
overview: A vision of a future society where technology and consumerism dominate, and free will is suppressed.

title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
author: Oscar Wilde
overview: A story about a man whose portrait ages while he remains eternally young and beautiful.

title: The Grapes of Wrath
author: John Steinbeck
overview: A tale of a family’s journey west during the Great Depression.

title: Of Mice and Men
author: John Steinbeck
overview: The story of two displaced migrant workers during the Great Depression.

title: East of Eden
author: John Steinbeck
overview: A story about two families and the generational struggles of good and evil.

title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
author: Gabriel García Márquez
overview: A multi-generational story of the Buendía family in the fictional town of Macondo.

title: Love in the Time of Cholera
author: Gabriel García Márquez
overview: A love story that spans decades in a Caribbean seaport town.

title: The Stranger
author: Albert Camus
overview: A philosophical novel about an emotionally detached man who commits an absurd murder.

title: The Plague
author: Albert Camus
overview: A story about a plague that strikes a town and the human responses to it.

title: Invisible Man
author: Ralph Ellison
overview: The story of an unnamed Black man in America who struggles to find his identity.

title: The Shadow of the Wind
author: Carlos Ruiz Zafón
overview: A mysterious tale set in post-World War II Barcelona surrounding a book called 'The Shadow of the Wind.'

title: The Name of the Rose
author: Umberto Eco
overview: A medieval murder mystery set in a Benedictine monastery.

title: The Handmaid’s Tale
author: Margaret Atwood
overview: A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian society where women’s rights have been stripped away.
